DescriptionText.Text: Build up your Cardio the old fashioned way: run. A lot.
Hold [sprint] to sprint. Press [jump] to climb or vault objects. Sprint into doors to smash them open.

NoteText.Text: XP penalty from A Pack a Day.

DescriptionText.Text: BASIC SKILL. Rule #1 for survival. If you run out of Stamina, that's it. Can't fight, can't run away. You're done.
It takes a little longer before I get tired.
Like the mighty crocodile, I'm very dangerous over short distances.
When zombies learn to drive, then I'll worry.
Cross-country? No problem.
How long before the 5k zombie run becomes a real sport?
You can choose a special technique related to this skill if you haven't already chosen a special technique.
All this Stamina and I didn't even have to dope! (Core Specializations: Marathon, Combat Endurance)
Sharpen your Wits by searching and scavenging.
Hold [xi_use] to search. Hold [sprint] + [xi_use] to search faster, but make more noise.
BASIC SKILL. When the shit hits the fan, you need to think fast. The quicker you can assess a situation, the better chance you have.
I'm getting better at casing stuff quickly.
Please, nobody ever keeps anything useful in the closet. It's all about the sock drawer.
I've learned some tricks for making less noise when I search stuff.
I've learned some tricks for making less noise when I search stuff.
I've learned some tricks for making less noise when I search stuff.
Kitchen, bathroom, garage. The Holy Trinity of efficient scavenging.
Just turn me loose in a room and I'll strip it to the copper in the walls.
Caution is key--now I'm less likely to break stuff when I search.
You can choose a special technique related to this skill if you haven't already chosen a special technique.
Caution is key--now I'm less likely to break stuff when I search. (Core Specialization: Ninja)
Caution is key--now I'm less likely to break stuff when I search.
Crush the skull, cleave the brain, sever the head. Keep at it and in no time you'll be a Self-Defense expert.
Press [ul_melee_attack] to attack. Press [cover] to dodge. Press [xi_use] to shove zombies away. Press [jump] for a leaping attack. Hold [sprint] for additional moves.

NoteText.Text: XP penalty from Two Left Feet.

DescriptionText.Text: BASIC SKILL. Sometimes the best defense is a lead pipe to the face. Other times, it's getting the hell out of the way.
No pain, no gain, right?
After dodging, quickly press [ul_melee_attack] for a damaging counterattack. (Must have melee weapon equipped.)
After dodging, quickly press [ul_melee_attack] for a damaging counterattack. (Must have melee weapon equipped.)
After dodging, quickly press [ul_melee_attack] for a damaging counterattack. (Must have melee weapon equipped.)
You can choose a melee weapon specialization if you haven't already chosen a weapon specialization.
Let's just say I don't cry when I stub my toe. Any more.
Barefoot in the snow, uphill both ways, etc. etc.
No, I'm not going to make a Black Knight joke here. Shut up.
You can choose a special technique related to this skill if you haven't already chosen a special technique.
I am become Shiva, destroyer of zombies. (Core Specializations: Rage, Brute Force)
One in the head, you know they're dead. And you get better at Firearms.
While aiming ([ul_aim]), press [firemode] to cycle rate of fire (automatic weapons only), or press [camera] to toggle zoom (scoped guns) or switch shoulder (non-scoped guns).
While aiming ([ul_aim]), press [firemode] to cycle rate of fire (automatic weapons only), or press [camera] to toggle zoom (scoped guns) or switch shoulder (non-scoped guns).
BASIC SKILL. Used to be shooting was just a hobby. Now it's a daily requirement.
The trick is to squeeze the trigger, not jerk it.
I've learned how to move quicker while aiming.
I've learned how to move quicker while aiming.
I've learned how to move quicker while aiming.
It's all about staying calm under pressure. I reload my guns a lot faster now.
You can choose a gun specialization if you haven't already chosen a weapon specialization.
It's all about staying calm under pressure. I reload my guns a lot faster now.
It's all about staying calm under pressure. I reload my guns a lot faster now.
Anything else is a waste of time. I can lock onto a zombies head from farther away now.
Anything else is a waste of time. I can lock onto a zombies head from farther away now.
Anything else is a waste of time. I can lock onto a zombies head from farther away now.
My guns don't wear out nearly as quick, and when they do jam I clear them faster.
My guns don't wear out nearly as quick, and when they do jam I clear them faster.
My guns don't wear out nearly as quick, and when they do jam I clear them faster.
I'm faster while aiming, I reload quicker, and I can lock in on a zombie's head from even farther away.
You can choose a special technique related to this skill if you haven't already chosen a special technique.
My hands are greased lightning. I'm faster while aiming, I reload quicker, and I can lock in on a zombie's head from even farther away. (Core Specializations: Run & Gun, Focus Aim)
I'm faster while aiming, I reload quicker, and I can lock in on a zombie's head from even farther away.
A Powerhouse wades into the middle of 'em and mixes it up hand-to-hand.
You can carry more weight in your pack before becoming encumbered.
You can carry more items per stack.
Reduced stamina penalty when using heavy weapons, and you can swing them a bit easier.
Increased mobility and control when using large machine guns.
PERSONAL SKILL. Just don't ask me to help you move furniture, okay?
I bench press more than my body weight, if that's what you mean.
You can choose one of two utility skills.
When I shove somebody, they move. (Class Specializations: Power Push, Power Kick)
You want two halves of a phone book? I've got a lot lying around.
I'm the strongest one there is. (Class Specializations: Pro Wrestling, Double Kill)
You can choose one of two defensive skills.
Survivor smash!
Nope, it's all natural. Shut up.
If you want quicker Reflexes, you've got to take the fight up close and personal.
PERSONAL SKILL. I'm quicker and more agile than most.
I could keep this up all day!
You can choose one of two utility skills.
Too slow, Mr. Zombie! (Class Specializations: Spin Kick, Sweep)
Just give me a second to catch my breath, and I'll be fine.
Nope, my name's not Lee, Chan, Norris or Jaa. Why do you ask? (Class Specializations: Leap Frog, Quick Counter)
You can choose one of two defensive skills.
You know what they say about butterflies and bees, right?
"Dodge this?" Don't mind if I do!
A Gifted Leader leads from the front lines, getting into the thick of it with their people and encouraging others to be their best.
PERSONAL SKILL. People are inclined to listen to me and do what I say.
Trust me.
I know what I'm doing.
Nice of you to see things my way.
Follow my lead!
I've gotten us out of worse spots than this, right? Just stick with me.
When this is all over, I should run for President!
You want to learn the ropes, you need on-the-job training or a good trade school. Neither's really around any more.
Dramatically decreases construction and upgrade times for facilities.
Allows Workshop to be upgraded to Machine Shop.
PERSONAL SKILL. It's more than just nailing planks together. Construction's an art form, and I may not be Monet, but I know how to color inside the lines.
Skills like these you gotta acquire by attending a fancy culinary school--or burning a lot of food. Either way, it's not happening now.
Allows you to prepare Feasts in your Kitchen.
PERSONAL SKILL. What's your poison? TexMex? Sushi? Indian/Guatemalan fusion? Or maybe just the perfect cheeseburger?
These are not the kind of skills you acquire by amateur experimentation, and good luck finding an accredited university out there.
Allows upgrade of Workshop to Munitions Shop.
Prevents mishaps when making explosives.
PERSONAL SKILL. No, no, no, I said an *Erlenmeyer* flask!
Yeah, right. You don't spend years studying, you might as well be telling people to swallow live spiders to cure their cough.
Allows you to upgrade an Infirmary to a Medical Lab.
Can save patients who would otherwise perish.
PERSONAL SKILL. Sure, it's nice having a good cook or somebody that can keep the peace around, but a good medic's worth their weight in ammo. You know it, I know it.

Look, it's a lot more complicated than just grabbing stuff off shelves and hoping you get lucky. You've got to know filing systems, interlibrary loans.... and none of that really exists any more, does it?
Collects notes on survival techniques, giving everyone a boost to Wits XP for the week.
Dramatically speeds up research projects.
PERSONAL SKILL. You think all I do is read books all day? It's called Library *Science* for a reason, motherfuckers!
You'd be surprised how much time and specialized equipment you need to get good at this. Too bad both are in short supply.
Allows establishment of a Fitness Regimen.
PERSONAL SKILL. Yeah, yeah, I've heard all the jokes about sadistic gym teachers and sleazy personal trainers. See if you're laughing when I leave you in the dust with the dead.
Increases likelihood of penalties on opposing team.
+25% scoring.
PERSONAL SKILL. Babe Ruth's batting average? .342. Ask me a tough one.
Rumors spread 20% faster.

NameText.Text: You Didn't Hear This From Me...

DescriptionText.Text: PERSONAL SKILL. Did you hear about Mary Jo Bligh?
Buy one get one on merchandise at all stores.
Doubles quantity of all purchases.
PERSONAL SKILL. If there's a deal, I'll find it.
Increase FPS by 5%.
PERSONAL SKILL. Man, that new solid-state drive I had on order is never gonna get here now....
+15% chance for your chosen contestant to advance to next round.
PERSONAL SKILL. I wonder what happened to the Housemates?
+15% to profit margin.
Conduct business deals anywhere.
PERSONAL SKILL. Coffee's for closers only.
+30% to flirt, but 15% chance of lawsuit or impeachment.
Allows use of No-No Picture on multiple recipients.
PERSONAL SKILL. Let me just peep your digits.
+30% to flirt, but 15% chance of lawsuit or impeachment.
Allows use of No-No Picture on multiple recipients.
PERSONAL SKILL. If you play your cards right, you may get hired to write the skill-description blurbs for an awesome video game.
+30% to flirt, but 15% chance of lawsuit or impeachment.
Allows use of No-No Picture on multiple recipients.
PERSONAL SKILL. Who needs subtitles?
+20 Sense of Superiority; -50 Trust
PERSONAL SKILL. Sorry your TV show suddenly ended. Good thing I already read the books.
+20 Sense of Superiority; -50 Trust
PERSONAL SKILL. Need a partner at Bridge? An opponent in Nerts? Someone who can tolerate Uno? You're looking in the right place.
+20 Sense of Superiority; -50 Trust
PERSONAL SKILL. When you enter the room playing your chosen instrument, everyone expects to see a cartoon elephant following behind you.
+20 Sense of Superiority; -50 Trust
PERSONAL SKILL. Spent many an all-nighter delivering "victory crouches" to opponents' faces.
+20 Sense of Superiority; -50 Trust
PERSONAL SKILL. I hope you don't have a problem with needles.
Unlocks a new Skill, granting additional benefits and new Abilities with a specific type of weapon.
Clubbing zombies on the head is a surefire way to improve your Blunt Weapon Specialization.
Master the use of Blunt Weapons.
Face, meet bat.
I think that made quite an... impression. Get it? Guys?
You can choose one of two special attacks.
Bonk! (Weapon Specializations: Uppercut, Spinning Backhand)
Don't get so bent out of shape, they're zombies, not baby seals.
Who needs a gun? Clubs don't run out of ammo.
Just call me "Skullcrusher." ... Please?
Slicing up zombies might dull your blade, but it'll sharpen your Edged Weapon Specialization.
Master the use of Edged Weapons.
How am I looking? ...Sharp.
Don't make me have to cut a zed.
You can choose one of two special attacks.
Slice! (Weapon Specializations: Low Slice, Behead)
Chiffonade! (Yes, it's a real word. Shut up.)
Sure it's a workout, but crushing zombies with large, heavy objects is the only way to master Heavy Weapon Specialization.
Master the use of Heavy Weapons.
Feel the burn! And the squish.
Why go for speed when you can have raw, brute force?
You can choose one of two special attacks.
It IS true that there's a place you can hit a zombie so its head will explode! (Weapon Specializations: Sweep, Spin)
Overkill? No such thing.
There's something comforting in carrying a weapon that weighs as much as a small child.
When everything looks like a nail, sooner or later you need a really big hammer.
Unlocks a new Skill, granting additional benefits and new Abilities with a specific type of weapon.
800,000 police officers can't be wrong: Pistol Specialization requires shooting things with pistols. In this case, zombies.
Master the use of Pistols.
Light, portable, and efficient. Just like me.
You have no idea how many times an extra round in the chamber has saved my ass.
You know they make pistols you can take through airport metal detectors now? Not that that's really relevant any more.
Pro shooters do it in the Weaver Stance.
Did I fire six shots, or just five? Doesn't matter, the mag holds 12.
Next time I kill a zombie, release this cote full of doves behind me, okay?
It's not rocket science: you want to improve your Revolver Specialization, you've got to dust off the old six-shooter and kill some zeds.
Master the use of Revolvers.
The trusty Saturday Night Special. Just as handy on Sundays.
Reach for it, Mister!
My mama always said these things were the Devil's right hand.
Just once I'd like to have a showdown at high noon....
Did I fire six shots, or just five?
I'm your huckleberry.
Ask any hunter and they'll tell you: you're not going to improve your Rifle Specialization unless you start bagging trophies with one.
When you raise your weapon to aim you'll snap to the target closest to your crosshairs. Increasing your snap distance with rifles enables you to use this ability at greater range.
Master the use of Rifles.
You get up close if you want; me, I'll stick to killing zombies from as far away as possible.
Rifle Specialization Improved!
LEVEL 4. Reloading a gun always looks so easy in the movies. Took me a while to get the hang of it. I'm so much more efficient now.
Damn shame there's no more biathalons. I'd clean up.
Rifle Specialization Improved!
Have rifle, will travel.
If you're lucky enough to get your hands on military-grade hardware, using it's the only way to keep up your Assault Rifle Specialization.
Master the use of Assault Weapons. (Rifles and SMGs)
When it comes to putting bullets in zombies, I've got three words: quantity, quantity, lots of bullets.
Aw, yeah, we're talking military-grade destruction here.
Sure it bucks like a donkey with a bee under its saddle, but it's just so satisfying!
Let's see anybody ban these bad boys now!
These things burn through clips like you wouldn't believe. So carry lots of clips.
What do you mean, "lowest bidder?"
Yeah, yeah, shotguns are a classic, but you've still got to use them to improve your Shotgun Specialization.
As you increase your mastery of shotguns you'll be able to maximize the effectiveness of the weapon's kill zone.
Master the use of Shotguns.
Don't rack the slide when there's a shell in the chamber. It makes you look like a jackass.
The trick is to not panic, just feed the shells in one by one.
Nothing like pulling the trigger and seeing a whole pack of zombies fall down.
Have you ever seen what double-aught buckshot can do to a zombie's head at close range?
In the old days they'd fill shotguns with nails, bits of glass, rocks, whatever they could get their hands on. Bet that'd ruin a zombie's day.
"12 gauge" is "I love you" in Survivor.
Unlocks one of two Special Attacks based on your Weapon Specialization.
Hold [sprint] and press [ul_melee_attack] to launch an attack guaranteed to knock the target down.
A powerful attack that knocks enemies down.
Hold [sprint] and press [ul_melee_attack] for a special attack that hits a large area in front of you.
A special attack that hits everything in a large area in front of you.
Hold [sprint] and press [ul_melee_attack] to launch an attack that hits a wide area in front of you. Has a high chance to trip enemies or remove their legs.
A special attack that hits everything in a wide area in front of you, with a chance to trip or dismember.
Hold [sprint] and press [ul_melee_attack] to launch a slow, Stamina-draining spinning attack that knocks down all normal zombies nearby.
Slow attack that hits all enemies around you and knocks them down.
Hold [sprint] and press [ul_melee_attack] to cut off an enemy's leg.
Special attack that dismembers the target's leg.
Hold [sprint] and press [ul_melee_attack] to launch a slow, focused attack guaranteed to decapitate the target.
Slow attack that automatically decapitates a single target.
Unlocks a Special Technique based on your Core Skills.
You're used to running long distances without tiring. Sprinting drains your Stamina 50% slower.
You're used to running long distances without tiring. Sprinting drains your Stamina 50% slower.
Unlocks a Special Technique based on your Core Skills.
Combat actions drain your Stamina 50% slower.
Decreases the rate at which you lose Stamina in combat.
Unlocks a Special Technique based on your Core Skills.
Doors are never considered locked for you, and you make no noise when you search. You can also move quickly while sneaking by holding [sprint].
Removes locked doors and makes searching silent. Also lets you move faster while sneaking.
Unlocks a Special Technique based on your Core Skills.
Every time you kill an enemy, you regain a small amount of Stamina.
Gives you a small amount of Stamina back when you kill an enemy in melee.
Unlocks a Special Technique based on your Core Skills.
While aiming [ul_aim], tap [sprint] to slow time for the world around you as long as your Stamina lasts.
Intense concentration makes the world around you slow to a crawl as you line up the perfect shot.
Unlocks a more powerful replacement for the shove attack ([xi_use]).
Hold [sprint] + hold [xi_use] for a more powerful shove that always knocks enemies down.
Slow shove guaranteed to knock enemies down.
Kick attack ([xi_use]) is replaced by a more powerful kick that pushes enemies back and staggers them.
Powerful kick that knocks back and staggers the target.
Unarmed attacks replaced by a spinning kick that knocks the target down.
Powerful spinning kick that knocks down a target.
Kick attack ([xi_use]) is replaced by a spinning leg sweep that trips enemies.
Area attack that has a high chance to trip targets.
Unlocks a new special ability triggered by your defensive moves ([cover]).

AltDescriptionText.Text: Press [roll] while near an enemy to suplex them. Press [xi_use] in the middle of the suplex to execute a finishing move.

DescriptionText.Text: Press [sprint] + [cover] while near an enemy to suplex them. Press [xi_use] in the middle of the suplex to execute a finishing move.
Special counter that lets you bodyslam enemies.
Hold [sprint] + [cover] while standing still to kill two enemies at once.
Special counter that kills two nearby enemies.

AltDescriptionText.Text: Press [roll] to leapfrog over an enemy and knock them to their knees.

DescriptionText.Text: Press [sprint] + [cover] to leapfrog over an enemy and knock them to their knees.
Special counter that lets you jump over an enemy and knock it to its knees.
While standing still, hold [sprint] + [cover] to automatically counter all incoming attacks.
Special technique that allows you to instantly counter incoming attacks.
